questionListItems.title: I have enrolled with Clinic A (e.g. Ang Mo Kio Branch). Can I access the Healthier SG Chronic Tier at Clinic B (e.g. Toa Payoh Branch)?

answer.body:
[Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] No, you can access the Healthier SG Chronic Tier at the specific clinic branch that you enrolled in (i.e. Clinic A - Ang Mo Kio Branch) and not at other clinics/ providers.

 

Healthier SG benefits and subsidies are available/accessible at your enrolled Healthier SG clinic.

questionListItems.title:
Can I claim for subsidies for different chronic condition(s) under the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier and existing CHAS Chronic Tier respectively during the same visit? 
(E.g. Chronic condition 1 may be more beneficial under the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier because it requires selected chronic medications, whereas chronic condition 2 may be better off under the existing CHAS Chronic Tier)

answer.body:
[From February 2024] At each visit, you can choose to either tap on subsidies under the existing CHAS Chronic Tier or the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier, regardless of the number of chronic conditions seen in each visit. The remaining dollar subsidy limits will be pro-rated accordingly for the next visit if a different subsidy tier is chosen.


You may wish to consult with your Healthier SG clinic/doctor about switching between the existing CHAS Chronic Tier and the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier, to cater for possible changes to your medication needs.


Healthier SG benefits and subsidies are available/accessible at your enrolled Healthier SG clinic.

Each Healthpoint is valid for 6 months. Your Healthpoints summary details (including its expiry date) can be found under the "My Wallet" tab in the Rewards section of Healthy 365 app.


For more information, please visit https://go.gov.sg/hpbrewardsfaqs

questionListItems.title: Do I need to make bookings for Healthier SG programmes, or can I just walk in?

answer.body: Selected programmes and activities are open for walk in, but slots are subject to availability. To ensure you get a slot, you are encouraged to make a booking beforehand through Healthy 365 app.

questionListItems.title: Can I access the HealthHub app to view my family member’s subsidy balances for CHAS and Healthier SG? How can I do so?

answer.body: [Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] Subsidy balance for both the existing CHAS and the new Healthier SG Chronic tiers can be viewed via your own MyCHAS. Your family members will need to login to MyCHAS at www.chas.sg using their Singpass to view their subsidy balance.

questionListItems.title: How do I check my subsidy balances for existing CHAS and the new Healthier SG Chronic Tiers?

answer.body: [Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] You can login to MyCHAS at www.chas.sg using your Singpass to view the subsidy balance for both your existing CHAS and the new Healthier SG Chronic tiers.

questionListItems.title: Can I choose which subsidy tier I want to claim the subsidies under, regardless of doctor/clinic’s advice?

answer.body:
[Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] Yes, patients have a choice of which subsidy tier (Healthier SG Chronic Tier or existing CHAS Chronic Tier) they would like to claim from for each visit.


Healthier SG benefits and subsidies are available/accessible at your enrolled Healthier SG clinic.

questionListItems.title: I'm a Blue/Orange/Green CHAS cardholder (non-MG/PG). Will my Healthier SG Chronic Tier subsidy be impacted, if my per capita household income and CHAS card status changes?

answer.body:
[Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] The Healthier SG Chronic Tier subsidies are tiered based on the CHAS card status.

 

Your subsidy tier will not be automatically changed when there are changes to your household income within the validity period. 

 

However, if there is a change to your household financial situation during your card's validity period, you may reach out to CHAS for further advice.

questionListItems.title: Under the Healthier SG Chronic Tier, can I receive subsidies for chronic medications that are not found on the Healthier SG Medication List?

answer.body:
[Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] Yes, CHAS, Merdeka Generation (MG) and Pioneer Generation (PG) cardholders can still receive dollar-based subsidies between $28 and $135 per visit, subjected to their eligible annual cap (based on their CHAS/MG/PG card status).

 

Healthier SG benefits and subsidies are available/accessible at your enrolled Healthier SG clinic.

questionListItems.title: How will my subsidy balance be calculated for my existing CHAS Chronic Tier and the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier, if I alternate between them for different visits?

answer.body:
[Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] Your remaining dollar-based subsidy balance will be pro-rated accordingly for each visit, depending on the subsidy tier that you choose to use for the visit. You may wish to consult your Healthier SG clinic/doctor about switching between the existing CHAS Chronic Tier and the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier, depending on your medication needs.

 

If your dollar-based limits under the existing CHAS Chronic Tier are exhausted, that would mean that your dollar-based limits under the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier would have been exhausted as well.

 

However, you will still be able to receive the percentage-based subsidies for selected chronic medications under the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier, as there is no cap to those subsidies.

 

Healthier SG benefits and subsidies are available/accessible at your enrolled Healthier SG clinic.

questionListItems.title:
I have chronic condition(s) and have enrolled in Healthier SG. 
How do I know which subsidy (Existing CHAS Chronic Tier or the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier) to use for my chronic condition(s) medication?

answer.body:
[Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] Patients with chronic conditions that have high medication needs and bills are likely to benefit from the Healthier SG Chronic Tier.

 

You may wish to consult with your enrolled Healthier SG doctor about whether you are suitable to switch to use selected chronic medications that are eligible for percentage subsidies under the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier.

questionListItems.title: I am a chronic patient. How do I know which category I belong to i.e., whether high or low medication use?

answer.body: [Healthier SG Medication List will be available from February 2024] Your medication needs depend on your condition(s). You may wish to consult with your Healthier SG clinic about the category you belong to and whether you are suitable to switch to use the selected chronic medications under the Healthier SG Medication List.

questionListItems.title: I would like to provide feedback to the Ministry of Health to consider including a particular medication for Healthier SG Chronic Tier subsidy. How can I do so?

answer.body: [Healthier SG Chronic Tier will be available from February 2024] You may send your feedback via www.MOH.gov.sg/feedback. The selected list of chronic medications under the Healthier SG Medication List that are eligible for percentage subsidies under the Heathier SG Chronic Tier will be reviewed periodically to ensure its relevance in supporting the management of chronic patients at Healthier SG GPs.

questionListItems.title:
a) I have been using a preferred medication brand throughout the years. To enjoy subsidies under the Healthier SG Chronic Tier, do I have to use the selected chronic medications under the Healthier SG Medication List? 

b) I prefer to use a specific brand of the selected chronic medication at my Healthier SG GP, will I be able to utilise the Healthier SG Chronic Tier?

answer.body:
[From February 2024] There are two subsidy components under the Healthier SG Chronic Tier:

i. A percentage subsidy component for selected chronic medications which has no dollar cap

ii. A dollar-based subsidy component for all services and other medications with a per visit and annual limit


Selected chronic medications under the Healthier SG Medication List will be eligible for the percentage-based subsidies under the Healthier SG Chronic Tier. All other medications will have to be claimed under the dollar component of the Healthier SG Chronic Tier.


If most of your medications are not in the list of selected chronic medications, it may be better to claim for your chronic care components via the existing CHAS Chronic Tier instead. You may wish to consult your Healthier SG clinic for further details on how you can tap on the new Healthier SG Chronic Tier.


If you prefer a particular brand of medication that is different from the subsidised brand(s) offered by your Healthier SG clinic, you may not be able to utilise the Healthier SG Chronic Tier subsidies. You may tap on the existing CHAS Chronic Tier subsidies or pay for the medication in full. Do consult your Healthier SG clinic on this. Similar to the polyclinic setting, patients may not select a specific brand of subsidised medication even if it is in the list of selected chronic medications under the Healthier SG Medication List.

Maintaining my Relationship with my Family Clinic
